content: The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" may be cited as the short title. This Act includes amendments to the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" includes amendments to the Civil Rights Act of 1964, adding protections for affectional or sexual orientation in public accommodations, facilities, federally assisted programs, and equal employment opportunities. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" amends various sections of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to include protections for affectional or sexual orientation by replacing instances of "sex" with "sex, affectional or sexual orientation." This amendment applies to public accommodations, facilities, federally assisted programs, and equal employment opportunities. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to include protections for affectional or sexual orientation by adding a new section to Title XI. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" adds protections for affectional or sexual orientation to the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" defines affectional or sexual orientation as male or female homosexuality, heterosexuality, and bisexuality between consenting adults. It clarifies that discrimination based on sexual orientation should not be determined by statistical differences or remedied by quotas. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" clarifies that no one is required to disclose their sexual orientation under the Act. The "Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993" amends the Civil Rights Act of 1968 to include protection against discrimination based on affectional or sexual orientation in housing sale and rental transactions, residential real estate, and brokerage services. It also addresses the prevention of intimidation based on these characteristics. The Civil Rights Amendments Act of 1993 prohibits discrimination based on affectional or sexual orientation in housing transactions.
